alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 11:01PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHOCTAW...NORTHERN WASHINGTON... CLARKE AND WAYNE COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CST... At 1100 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Boyd to 5 miles west of Crandall to near Moss. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Waynesboro, Thomasville, Butler, Grove Hill, Chatom, Saint Stephens, Wagarville, Leroy, Clara, Whatley, Lisman, Millry, Buckatunna, State Line, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Fulton, and Gilbertown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for south central and southwestern Alabama...and southeastern Mississippi.
